Congressional attention to health-related tax expenditures raises questions about their value, changes over time, and comparison to total revenue collected. The report analyzes historical data on health-related tax expenditure estimates published by the Joint Committee on Taxation (JCT) to determine the increase in tax expenditures since the enactment of the ACA and how they compare to total revenue collected. It also examines the size of health tax expenditures relative to discretionary and mandatory outlays on health programs in past years, as well as the growth of federal support for health through direct outlays versus revenue losses from tax expenditures.
